pullRequest.body:
- Define the `WithVal` type synonym equipping a ring with a valuation
- Refactor `HeightOneSpectrum.adicCompletion` to `Valuation.Completion`, making use of the `Valued` instance on `WithVal`
- Fix errors generated by the above changes in mathlib

---

- [x] depends on: #22139
- [x] depends on:  #22407

Following a [comment and TODO on Ya√´l‚Äôs recent PR](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21301#discussion_r1956184620), I decided to resurrect and push a local branch of mine from last year where I played around with a `WithVal` type synonym and refactor of `HeightOneSpectrum.adicCompletion` in analogy to `WithAbs` and `InfinitePlace.Completion`. I never pushed it because I was concerned that it would have a big impact on downstream work, but following the above comment I think it‚Äôs worth having a discussion about this refactor in this PR. As expected, the refactor generated a number of errors across some files, which I‚Äôve fixed, but I know there is a lot of work happening in this area outside of mathlib, so I‚Äôve requested reviews from people that I know are currently using `adicCompletion`. Keen to hear everyone‚Äôs thoughts and concerns about this.

My two cents is that this would make it a lot easier to work with `adicCompletion` long term, but it‚Äôs not clear to me how disruptive this would be to others' work and whether it‚Äôs worth it.

Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Don't forget to remove `awaiting-author` if you think you've addressed all the changes!

> Don't forget to remove `awaiting-author` if you think you've addressed all the changes!

‚òùÔ∏è
I am not at a computer for possibly a day, so feel to move forward without me
Indeed, I see the renames to existing lemmas as being out of scope for the current PR. You could make it either a preliminary PR or parallel PR.

Yes I had also noticed that some of the results should ideally be in `FinitePlaces` namespace, but wasn't sure whether to change them here. I think we may as well address them during this refactor, so I will make a preliminary PR

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#22139~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#22407~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13605167043/job/38035794532)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13605167043/job/38035794648)

Thanks!

maintainer merge
Amazing! Looks like a great improvement.
Thanks, LGTM!

I am happy with all changes, but I have suggested a couple of renaming/moving into namespaces. I would be happy in seeing these moves inside this PR, but I know that @yaeldillies normally has a different point of view, and let them have a word about this.

Thanks!

maintainer merge
This change looks like it makes up most of the diff. Personally, I am not convinced it is useful. Could you either drop it or move it to a separate PR?

We could drop it, but then `WithVal` cannot infer `K` from `v.valuation`, so we would need to write `WithVal (v.valuation : Valuation K ‚Ñ§‚Çò‚ÇÄ))` or `WithVal (v.valuation (K := K))` everywhere. Maybe the latter is preferable to the explicit arg? I don't have strong opinions here, but `WithVal (v.valuation : Valuation K  ‚Ñ§‚Çò‚ÇÄ))` is a bit long to keep writing
I'm not particularly for or against. I just think it should be discussed separately, ie in another PR
OK makes sense! Have reverted that change

I have been planning to give a proper review to this PR, but overall I believe it is really good. On the other hand, I dissent from @YaelDillies 's point: not having to write `K` is a very good reason for it, and I thing this change highly appropriate for this PR. It makes up for most of the diff, but in a very "trivial manner", so I would suggest re-reverting .

> not having to write `K` is a very good reason for it

Then it can be a preliminary PR
This is a very good idea! @smmercuri Do not hesitate to ping me if you open the new PR.
Preliminary PR here! #22139

```suggestion
    Valued.v (r : v.adicCompletion K) = v.valuation K r := by
```

```suggestion
    (v.valuationOfNeZeroToFun x : ‚Ñ§‚Çò‚ÇÄ) = v.valuation K x := by
```

```suggestion
  rw [show v.valuation K x = _ * _ by rfl]
```

```suggestion
    (Polynomial.idealX K).valuation _ P = (PowerSeries.idealX K).valuation K‚∏®X‚∏© P := by
```

```suggestion
theorem embedding_apply (x : K) : embedding v x = ‚Üëx := rfl
```

```suggestion
    toNNReal (norm_ne_zero v) ((WithVal.instValued (v.valuation K)).v x) =
```
I guess you'll remove those comments before merging?

I wasn't sure what the best practice is here. I thought it might be useful to leave them as comments in case there's any future confusing about missing named instances, but I don't really mind and can delete them if you think that's best.
I think deleting is best here
Now removed
Yuck. What happened here?

Yeah... this one gave me a headache. I think a diamond is happening so this was a plaster to make it behave as it did before. To be honest, I'm not sure this instance is required as deleting it gave no errors. @faenuccio do you know whether this instance is needed?
I do not think is needed any more, so you can safely delete it.

```suggestion
# Ring topologised by a valuation
```

```suggestion
/-- Type synonym for a ring equipped with the topology coming from a valuation. -/
```
@smmercuri, please change this in the file header too.
I don't think the codomain can be an outParam since one might have several different G0s for the same R. outParam only works when R completely determines G0.
Oh yes, thanks! removed

In this prelimiary doc I would suggest that you explain a bit more in detail how to use the type `WithVal`: for instance, you say that `WithVal v` is a type synonim for `R` without saying what the relation between `v` and `R` is. You might also add a word about why it is useful.
Sounds good, added some more info
Thanks!
Is this needed?
No, I think I just copied it over from `WithAbs`. I've removed it and `Nontrivial` which was also not needed
This also can be inferred automatically, now.
pehaps a @simp?
I have made `embedding_apply` simp instead as that would be more useful I think
Actually, this caused some downstream errors in another file, so reverting this for now
I see: reverting was a good idea, but if you can point to a commit where I can see the errors, I would like to inspect this (I am not requesting any change).
Sure, it was this one https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22055/commits/ce217682725b50995184f3cef2607bf1abafda4c

Thanks, I'll have a look. What's your take on @YaelDillies 's suggestion of opening a new PR for the renaming I suggested? I am asking simply to understand if you're planning to do something *before* this PR gets through, *after*, *meanwhile*, *never*, or any other temporal adverb you might come up with üòÑ
Why do you need to find this instance manually _in the statement_?

`valuedAdicCompletion` no longer exists because the `Valued (v.adicCompletion K) Zm0` instance now follows directly from `Valued.valuedCompletion`, so I was just replacing it with `inferInstanceAs _`. I've now replaced it with `(Valued.v : Valuation (v.adicCompletion K) Zm0)`
It doesn't look so good having to refer to instances by name in lemma statements. What's happening here?
I had not properly refactored `FinitePlaces`! This should now be fixed

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
isomorphism should be used to explicitly map terms of `WithVal v` to terms of `R`.
```
I would rename this `equiv_apply` (so that, with the full namespace, it becomes `WithVal.equiv_apply`), otherwise it looks like `WithVal.apply` giving no clue at *what* is being applied.

I would do
```suggestion
theorem apply_equiv (r : WithVal v) : v (WithVal.equiv v r) = v r := rfl
```
This one is actually no longer needed, so I've removed it
Well, as a matter of fact I'd keep it: it is no longer needed *now*, but this is a kind of boilerplate you might want to keep.
We're just in the namespace `NumberField`, so I think that the word "finite" should appear somewhere in this `embedding` (perhaps by putting everyting below in a `FinitePlace` namespace?)
I think that this result about the norm, and its companions, should appear in the doc at the top of the file.

I think all this should go inside the `FinitePlace` namespace because `norm_le_one` is false if `v` is archimedean. If you think this should go to another PR I understand, but I would then open that one before resuming this. Insofar I am concerned, keeping it here is OK.
`valuation_apply` perhaps?
Why is this rename still around?
Oh because I missed this one in the the preliminary PR and only caught it today when merging. Just added a deprecation for this
Ah okay, no problem!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `WithVal` type synonym and refactor of `HeightOneSpectrum.adicCompletion`
